frontmatter.title: Java interoperability
frontmatter.description: The Java Interoperability Guide aims at providing a reference source for the Bindgen Tool and the Ballerina FFI.
frontmatter.keywords: ballerina, programming language, java api, interoperability
frontmatter.intro: Ballerina offers a straightforward way to call the existing Java code from Ballerina. Although Ballerina is not designed to be a JVM language, the current implementation, which targets the JVM, aka jBallerina, provides Java interoperability by adhering to the Ballerina language semantics.

pageProps.content: ## Ballerina bindings to Java code You can write Ballerina code (Ballerina bindings) that lets you call the corresponding Java API as illustrated in the diagram below. The [Ballerina FFI](/learn/java-interoperability-guide/ballerina-ffi) explains how to write the Ballerina bindings manually. Learning to write them manually helps you to understand the inner workings of calling Java from Ballerina. Alternatively, you can use the [Bindgen Tool](/learn/java-interoperability-guide/the-bindgen-tool/) to generate these bindings automatically while eliminating the need for understanding the Ballerina FFI layer. It also explains how to customize the bindings generated by the Bindgen Tool.
